cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles W of Cabo Cruz, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across central-western Cuba, turning north-northwest toward the Florida Straits and up the west coast of Florida, then recurving northeast along the Southeast U.S. coast toward the Mid-Atlantic and New England waters.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west coast of Florida (Big Bend area, north of Tampa)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in the Mid-Atlantic or Northeast at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in the Mid-Atlantic or Northeast at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys and west coast of Florida, then coastal Georgia, South Carolina, North Carolina, Virginia, and New England (including Long Island and the New Jersey shore)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≈3%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; most likely breezy conditions 25–35 mph with higher gusts Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal anomalies (<2 ft) possible along lower New York Harbor and back bays if the center passes close to the coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rainfall possible Friday into early Saturday with locally higher amounts, leading to ponding on terminals and poor drainage flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents along ocean-facing terminals and possible brief marine thunderstorm squalls.
